document.docAuthor: Oliveira, Luiz Fernando M. & Brescovit, Antonio D.
document.masterDocTitle: The spider genus Patrera Simon (Araneae: Dionycha, Anyphaeninae) in the Atlantic Forest biome, with the description of one new species from Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The spider genus Patrera Simon (Araneae: Dionycha, Anyphaeninae) in the Atlantic Forest biome, with the description of one new species from Brazil

Vital Brasil, 1500, 05503 - 900, São Paulo, SP, Brazil.

Laboratório de Coleções Zoológicas, Instituto Butantan, Av. Vital Brasil, 1500, 05503 - 900, São Paulo, SP, Brazil. & antonio. brescovit @ butantan. gov. br; https: // orcid. org / 0000 - 0002 - 1511 - 5324

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Anyphaena cita Keyserling, 1891: 94
, figs 55–55a ( Syntypes three male and one female from Paineiras, Corcovado (currently

subSubSection.paragraph:
Parque Nacional da Tijuca, 22°57’43.2”S 43°14’52.8”W ), Prof. Göldi leg., deposited in BMNH 1890.4.1.603-606, examined). Lectotype male BMNH 1890.4.1.603 and paralectotypes BMNH 1890.4.1.604-606 here designated.
Wulfila cita : Simon, 1897: 94
, fig 94.
Teudis citus : Petrunkevitch, 1911: 516
.
Patrera cita : Brescovit, 1997: 33
.

Diagnosis. Males of
Patrera cita
can be easily distinguished from the remaining species by the internal border of the tegular projection enveloping almost of the embolus and by the very short, conical retrolateral tibial apophysis in the male palp ( Figs 8C–E , 9B , 10B–E ). Females are diagnosed by presenting a hood with straight border and by the small subrectangular, shallow atrium in the epigynum ( Figs 8F , 9D , 10F ).

Description. Male ( Holotype ). Carapace, chelicerae and legs orange; labium and endites yellow; sternum yellow with brown lateral borders. Abdomen dorsally grayish ventrally cream as well as the spinnerets ( Fig. 8A ). Total length 6.5, carapace length 2.8, width 2.45. Clypeus height 0.06. Eye diameters and interdistances: AME 0.08, ALE 0.20, PME 0.18, PLE 0.20; AME–AME 0.07, AME–ALE 0.05, PME–PME 0.16, PME–PLE 0.11, ALE–PLE 0.05. Chelicerae 2.17 long, five promarginal teeth, seven retromarginal denticles ( Figs 9A , 10A ). Leg measurements: leg I—femur 4.25/ patella 1.35/ tibia 4.5/ metatarsus 4.25/ tarsus 1.75/ total 16.10; II—4.1/ 1.3/ 4.3/ 4.05/ 1.6/ 15.35; III—2.55/ 0.9/ 2.1/ 2.7/ 0.85/ 9.1; IV—3.7/ 1.05/ 3.3/ 4.2/ 1.2/ 13.45. Leg spination: I—tibia v2-0-0, p1-1-1, r1-1-1, metatarsus v2-2-0, p1-1-1, r1-1-0; II—tibia v2-0-0, p1-1-1, r1-1-1, metatarsus v2-2-0, p1-1-1, r1-1-1; III—tibia v2- 2-2, p1-1-0, r1-1-0, metatarsus v2-2-2, p1-1-1, r1-1-1; IV—tibia v2-2-2, p1-1-1, r1-1-1, metatarsos v2-2-2, p1-1-1, r1-1-1. Abdomen: length 4.0, epigastric furrow 2.7 from tracheal spiracle, spiracle 1.95 from base of spinnerets. Palp: tibia slightly larger than cymbium, slightly curved; retrolateral tibial apophysis with serrated border; oval cymbium, with small basal retrolateral projection; oval tegulum, with part of the sperm duct exposed at the base of the tegulum; tegular shell-shaped projection, not apically projected; elongated, flat median apophysis, with curved apex; filiform embolus, as long as the tegulum, with basal origin, surrounded by tegular projection, except distal portion ( Figs 8C–E , 9B, C , 10B–E ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 8A–G.
Patrera cita ( Keyserling, 1891 )
. Male (IBSP 139332): A habitus, dorsal view; C left palp, ventral view; D same, retrolateral view; E same, dorsal view. Female (IBSP 139332): B habitus, dorsal view; F epigynum, ventral view; G epigynum, dorsal view. Abbreviations: CD, copulatory ducts; E, embolus; FD, fertilization ducts; MA, median apophysis; RTA, retrolateral tibial apophysis; SR, seminal receptacles; ST, subtegulum; T, tegulum. Scale bars: A, B 3.5mm; C–G 0.25mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female (IBSP 138589). Coloration as in male ( Fig. 8B ). Total length 5.6, carapace length 2.5, width 1.9. Clypeus height 0.07. Eye diameters and interdistances: AME 0.07, ALE 0.17, PME 0.16, PLE 0.16; AME–AME 0.06, AME–ALE 0.05, PME–PME 0.12, PME–PLE 0.07, ALE–PLE 0.05. Chelicerae 1.05 long, five promarginal teeth,

seven retromarginal denticles. Leg measurements: leg I—femur 3.05/ patella 1.1/ tibia 3.2/ metatarsus 2.55/ tarsus 1.1/ total 11.0; II—2.9/ 1.05/ 2.85/ 2.45/ 1.05/ 10.3; III—1.9/ 0.75/ 1.5/ 1.9/ 0.65/ 6.7; IV—2.9/ 0.9/ 2.4/ 3.0/ 0.9/ 10.1. Leg spination: I— II—tibia v2-2-0, p1-1-1, r1-1-1, metatarsus v2-0-0, p1-1-1, r1-1-1; III—tibia v2-1-0, p1- 1-0, r1-1-0, metatarsus v2-2-2, p1-1-1, r1-1-1; IV—tibia v2-1-2, p1-1-0, r1-1-0, metatarsus v2-2-2, p1-1-1, r1-1-1. Abdomen: length 3.05, epigastric furrow 1.1 from tracheal spiracle, spiracle 1.7 from base of spinnerets. Epigynum: lateral borders short, not connected distally; small atrium; internally with long, coiled, basal copulatory ducts; globose seminal receptacles, in the proximal area of the copulatory ducts; oval spermathecae, dorsally positioned in relation to the copulatory ducts; short fertilization ducts, curved, basal ( Figs 8F, G , 9D, E , 10F ).
Variation. Males (n=10): total length 5.8–8.5; carapace length 2.5–3.5; femur I length 3.3–5.3; Females (n=10): total length: 5.2–8.0; carapace length 2–3.2; femur I length 2.2–4.1.
Distribution . Northeast, Southeast and South of the Brazil ( Fig. 27A ).
